keyActivities: Design, manufacture, and sell commercial aircraft
keyResources: Engineers, manufacturing facilities, intellectual property, patents, distribution network
valueProposition: High-quality, fuel-efficient, and reliable aircraft for airlines, providing passengers with a comfortable flying experience
customerRelationships: Long-term contracts with airlines, maintenance and support services, consulting and training
channels: Direct sales, air shows, industry conferences, partnerships with airlines
customerSegments: Airlines, governments, private and corporate clients, cargo carriers
structure: Engineering, manufacturing, sales and marketing, customer support, supply chain
revenueStreams: Aircraft sales, aftermarket services, maintenance and support, training, consulting
problem: The need for fuel-efficient, reliable, and comfortable aircraft for global transportation
solution: Innovative aircraft designs, advanced materials, and state-of-the-art technologies to improve efficiency and passenger experience
keyMetrics: Aircraft orders, delivery performance, customer satisfaction, market share
uniqueSellingProposition: Advanced aircraft designs, focus on sustainability, strong customer support
highLevelConcept: Connecting the world with innovative and efficient aircraft
unfairAdvantage: Strong engineering capabilities, partnerships with suppliers and airlines, long-term contracts with customers
earlyAdopters: Major airlines adopting new aircraft models, governments investing in air transportation infrastructure
mobileAdvantages: In-flight connectivity, mobile app for airlines and passengers
camera: Enhanced in-flight entertainment systems with cameras
microphone: In-flight entertainment systems with voice control
appIntegrations: Airlines integrating Airbus aircraft data with their apps
attractUsers: Showcasing aircraft at air shows, industry events, and partnerships
offline: In-flight entertainment systems for offline use
appSavings: Efficient maintenance and support through connected apps
inAppPayments: In-flight purchases and services for airlines and passengers
peopleAndRoles: Engineers designing aircraft, sales team securing orders, manufacturing teams building aircraft
commonGoals: Delivering innovative, efficient, and reliable aircraft for global air transportation
personalGoals: Improving air travel experience and contributing to the growth of the aviation industry
purpose: Connecting the world through advanced and sustainable aircraft
needsAndExpectations: Meet the growing demand for air travel while minimizing environmental impact
rulesAndActivities: Compliance with aviation regulations, collaboration between teams, continuous improvement
strengthsAndAssets: Strong engineering capabilities, global distribution network, customer relationships
weaknessesAndRisks: Competition, economic downturns affecting air travel, fluctuations in fuel prices
buyerPersona: Airlines looking to expand or modernize their fleet, governments investing in air transportation
buyerGoals: Acquire fuel-efficient, reliable, and comfortable aircraft
buyerInitiatives: Airlines seeking to improve passenger experience and reduce operational costs
buyingProcess: Evaluating aircraft models, negotiating contracts, securing financing
buyTiming: Depends on market conditions, fleet expansion plans, and aircraft retirement schedules
buyerThinking: Considering factors such as cost, performance, maintenance, and support
buyerChannels: Direct contact with Airbus sales teams, industry events, and conferences
whyBuy: Airbus provides innovative aircraft designs, fuel efficiency, and strong customer support
buyerInfluencers: Airlines' decision-makers, government regulations, and market trends
buyerContent: Airlines and governments evaluate the long-term value and performance of aircraft options
strengths: Innovative aircraft designs, focus on sustainability, strong customer support, and engineering capabilities
opportunities: Growing global air travel demand, focus on sustainable aviation, emerging markets
weaknesses: Competition from other aircraft manufacturers, reliance on suppliers, potential for production delays
threats: Economic downturns, geopolitical tensions, fluctuations in fuel prices, emerging competitors
productsAndServices: Commercial aircraft (e.g., A320, A330, A350, A380), military aircraft, helicopters, space and defense systems
gainCreators: Efficient aircraft, advanced technology, improved passenger experience
painRelievers: Reducing operating costs for airlines, minimizing environmental impact
gains: Airlines benefit from fuel savings, improved fleet performance, and passenger satisfaction
pains: Airlines face challenges in maintaining and upgrading their fleets, meeting environmental regulations
customerJobs: Airlines need aircraft to transport passengers and cargo, governments need aircraft for defense and transportation
